data.title: Feature request: Extension size information

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version:
Version 1.8.1
Commit ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281
Date 2016-12-19T14:41:20.664Z
Shell 1.4.6
Renderer 53.0.2785.143
Node 6.5.0

- OS Version:
Gnome Ubuntu 16.10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open the extension panel
2. Click on an extension to open the information panel
3. There is no information related to the total size of the file that has to be download to install the extension

It would be good to have both, the size of the file and how much space will take once installed

data.title: Fix colorization of nested list.
data.body:
Fixed colorization of nested list with unindented line.
Previously, bullets of nested list with empty line above was not colored.

This change related to #19417 which updated markdown-it version,
and after applied that, two consecutive newlines no longer terminate a list.

This PR is modified one of #19559

data.title: "Cannot read property 'toLowerCase' of undefined" during run task
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.9.0-insider (e68cede8b65dc918332493146c2572a7e132a451, 2017-01-27T20:36:09.447Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.4.0
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-clock|Compulim|0.0.1|
|mayaport|JonMacey|1.0.0|
|vscode-docker|PeterJausovec|0.0.11|
|code-settings-sync|Shan|2.4.2|
|project-manager|alefragnani|0.13.1|
|python|donjayamanne|0.5.6|
|vscode-material-theme|fredrikaverpil|0.0.3|
|theme-material-theme|jprestidge|1.0.1|
|prettify-json|mohsen1|0.0.3|
|mel|sator-imaging|0.1.1|
|trailing-spaces|shardulm94|0.2.11|
|jinja|wholroyd|0.0.7|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Use provided `tasks.json` and cmd+shift+p "Run task" "Cross-OS executable"

```json
{
    "version": "0.1.0",
    "tasks": [
        {
            "taskName": "Cross-OS executable",
            "osx": {
                "command": "/foo/bar",
                "args": ["baz"]
            },
            "windows": {
                "command": "C:\\foo\\bar.exe",
                "args": ["baz"]
            },
            "isShellCommand": true,
            "isBackground": false,
            "echoCommand": true,
            "showOutput": "always"
        }
    ]
}
```

Expected behavior: Run `/foo/bar baz` on OS X and `C:\foo\bar baz` on Windows.
Actual behavior: Error: Cannot read property 'toLowerCase' of undefined (and the task seems to hang)

data.title: Environment variable not expanded during task run
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.9.0-insider (e68cede8b65dc918332493146c2572a7e132a451, 2017-01-27T20:36:09.447Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.4.0
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-clock|Compulim|0.0.1|
|mayaport|JonMacey|1.0.0|
|vscode-docker|PeterJausovec|0.0.11|
|code-settings-sync|Shan|2.4.2|
|project-manager|alefragnani|0.13.1|
|python|donjayamanne|0.5.6|
|vscode-material-theme|fredrikaverpil|0.0.3|
|theme-material-theme|jprestidge|1.0.1|
|prettify-json|mohsen1|0.0.3|
|mel|sator-imaging|0.1.1|
|trailing-spaces|shardulm94|0.2.11|
|jinja|wholroyd|0.0.7|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Use the provided `tasks.json` and cmd+shift+p "Run Task" `Expansion issue`


```json
{
    "version": "0.1.0",
    "tasks": [
        {
            "taskName": "Expansion issue",
            "command": "echo",
            "osx": {
                "args": ["$HOME"]
            },
            "windows": {
                "args": ["%HOMEDRIVE%%HOMEPATH%"]
            },
            "isShellCommand": true,
            "isBackground": false,
            "echoCommand": true,
            "showOutput": "always"
        }
    ]
}
```

Expected output is: `/Users/fredrik`
Actual output is: `$HOME`


I don't know if this is perhaps not a finished feature yet, but I figured I'd mention it as I'm able to use environment variables in vscode 1.8 - and this is super useful.

data.title: Fix TS Version Selector When Local Version === Global Version
data.body:
**Bug**
When the global tsdk setting points to the workspace version of typescript, our ts selector interface can get confused on which version is currently active

**Fix**
Adds a check using the local storage value to show the correct active version

data.title: Move markdown preview content provider to own file
error notice preventing solution
data.body:
I get an error popup that looks like this:

![selection_086](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1542720/22438485/6bbe4d48-e6e9-11e6-81c0-538dc7f5df25.png)

the solution as far as i know is to press the revert to disk button found in the tab area. It's blue in this image: 

![selection_087](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1542720/22438509/8848748e-e6e9-11e6-9cf7-9b2925bde153.png)

Unfortunately, the error notice hides the tab bar and therefore it can't be accessed without shuffling it to the right split panel. 

The error is not dismissed until that blue button is pressed.

- VSCode Version:
1.8.1
- OS Version:
Ubuntu 16.04

Steps to Reproduce:

1. open a git diff
2. change the file in the diff and save it
3. revert the file from the sidebar menu

data.title: Single Quote in Param Validation for PowerShell treats everything following as string in highlighting.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.1 (ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281, 2016-12-19T14:49:23.350Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|python|donjayamanne|0.5.6|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.9.0|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Include this param in your ps1 script param block
```powershell
        [parameter(Mandatory=$true, ParameterSetName="new", HelpMessage='Email Address associated with this Certificate.')][ValidatePattern('^[_a-z0-9-]+(\.[_a-z0-9-]+)*@[a-z0-9-]+(\.[a-z0-9-]+)*(\.[a-z]{2,4})$')]
        [String]$email,
```
2. Most of the lines of the script following this line will be color highlighted as strings, even if they are not string but rather variables, functions or even commented out lines. See screenshot below:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1291811/22434874/e296be58-e6eb-11e6-8b24-7a309733a570.png)

data.title: Logitech MX Master Back Button does nothing on Mac, should (Go -> Back)

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: MacOS Sierra 10.12.3

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Using a Logitech MX Master Mouse, set any of the buttons to the "Back" functionality.
2. Click the back button after navigating in VSCode from one file to another.
3. Watch nothing happen.

Here are my settings in the Logitech Options software:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13021263/22433512/d722cb22-e6d5-11e6-8903-184b1546371f.png)

Examples:
 - Spotify: Back Button goes back through the navigation (View -> Go Back).
 - Chrome: Navigates back through the pages (History -> Back).

Each of the above examples are using different keyboard shortcuts, but both are achieved by pressing the same  back button on the mouse.

I would love to see this functionality in VSCode on the Mac.

Thanks,

John

- OS Version: Windows 10

-- Sorry for the English, I used Google Translator --

See the gif. All extensions disabled.

![space](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19866231/22432674/d874580c-e6fc-11e6-877c-db7b8ddca732.gif)

If I give tab by any program the VSCode recognizes `->`, but if it gives tab by the VSCode itself it recognizes as space `...`.

data.title: Formatting not working after using inline style attribute in html
data.body:
Hello Team, I'm using VSCode since last 6 months. Recently I started to work on angular 2 and when I try to format HTML it's format wrong. I will show with a example. When I try to format below HTML it's working absolutely fine. ```
Hello HTML
``` But when I add inline style as below ```
Hello HTML
``` It format as below ```
Hello HTML
``` After next line of inline style formatting won't work or working wrong. Next line reset indent. I don't know about problem but I think this is issue, need to fix. - VSCode Version: 1.8.1 - OS Version: Window 7 SP 1

data.title: Return doesn't dismiss setting a variable
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.8.1 or 1.9.0
- OS Version: macOS

Steps to Reproduce:

1. start node debug session and break somewhere
2. select simple variable in VARIABLES view
3. from context menu select "Set Value"
4. enter some value and hit return.

Observe: edit fields disappears briefly and comes back. You have to click somewhere else to make the edit field go away.

This is not a regression in 1.9.0 but in 1.8.1 (it was working fine in 1.7.2).

data.title: Explorer: Search File Listing
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.8.1 (1.8.1)
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.2 (16C67)

*Feature Request*

1. When focused within the [file] Explorer, it's not possible to search by the names of all directories & files starting at the root of the explorer itself.
2. It's also not possible to navigate up from the root directory in the Explorer.

Feature no. 1 is very similar to NERDTree in vim: when focused, you can /$searchterm for specific files and open them in the buffer with a quick <Enter> (amongst other things). Feature no. 2 is an extension of that: improving the general file navigation within the Explorer.

data.title: [WelcomeUX] Welcome page should not show during extension development/debugging
[json] VS Code can't handle U+2028 in a JSON string
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.8.1 (Commit ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281, Date `2016-12-19T14:41:20.664Z`, Shell 1.4.6, Renderer 53.0.2785.143, Node 6.5.0)
- OS Version: Ubuntu 14.04.5 LTS (Trusty)

## Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to the https://github.com/minimaxir/big-list-of-naughty-strings repo and download [`blns.json`](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/minimaxir/big-list-of-naughty-strings/8a115584931e0aef2965d8f2b6ab212a08a93a4c/blns.json).
2. Load that file into VS Code.
3. Look at line 96, which contains a U+2028 LINE SEPARATOR character near the end of the string.
4. The U+2028 character has been replaced by  (U+FFFD REPLACEMENT CHARACTER) visually. But if you copy and paste from that line, you still get the U+2028 character contained in the file; the replacement is only visual.
5. Line 96 has two wavy red lines indicating syntax errors in the JSON. The first one, to the left of the U+2028, reads "Unexpected end of string". The right one reads "Expected comma or closing bracket /
End of file expected". Neither error is correct; according to http://timelessrepo.com/json-isnt-a-javascript-subset, U+2028 is a perfectly valid character to embed in a JSON string and does not indicate the end of the string. (It is *not* a valid character in *Javascript* strings, though, which I suspect is the cause of VS Code's difficulty in dealing with this tricky string).

## Screenshots

Line 96 of the `blns.json` file:
![U+2028 part 1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/90762/22411475/e58c3dd2-e6d6-11e6-8290-404ec75d643f.png)

First error message:
![U+2028 part 2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/90762/22411514/3393a7ae-e6d7-11e6-8a22-9ebff0712f4a.png)

Second error message:
![U+2028 part 3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/90762/22411523/58fdcf60-e6d7-11e6-911e-78f620ebf66c.png)

## Other VS Code versions

I happened to have an older version of the insiders' build lying around (Version 1.8.0-insider, Commit 2c8ab1a5ffc49ac26b2080bfbbbf9317fb8071bb), so I tested with it. While the U+2028 character is still replaced with U+FFFD visually in that version, commit 2c8ab1a5ffc49ac26b2080bfbbbf9317fb8071bb does *not* produce wavy red lines and error messages. (Which is the correct behavior since that string is valid JSON).

I then installed the latest (as of this writing) version of the insiders' build (Version 1.9.0-insider, Commit 3af0e9d6b79145011a7be3970c1d4b83d69b0443). This version DID exhibit the exact same bug as VS Code version 1.8.1: wavy red lines and the same two incorrect error messages.
